text: Robert Alexander QC FRS, FSA (18 January 1795 – 21 February 1843) was a British judge and philanthropist from Halifax, West Yorkshire.http://duckduckgo.com/Robert_Alexander_(Halifax) He was the son of Halifax solicitor Lewis Alexander and studied law at Lincoln's Inn. He became a barrister-at-law. He was a founding member of the Halifax Literary & Philosophical Society, and was made a fellow of the Royal Society in 1835. He died in London in 1843 and was buried at St Nicholas churchyard, Ganton, Yorkshire. He had married in 1829 Matilda Legard, daughter of Sir Thomas Legard, RN of Ganton. == References == ==External links== * findagrave memorial] Category:1795 births Category:1843 deaths Category:People from Halifax, West Yorkshire Category:Members of Lincoln's Inn Category:English judges Category:English philanthropists Category:Fellows of the Royal Society Category:19th-century philanthropists
